items.name: Dynamics of Company Waste Operations with Scaling Analysis
items.description: As a Complexity Researcher in the Santa Fe Institute's Undergraduate Complexity Research (formerly REU) program, I was able to work alongside PhD and resident faculty on a complex systems project of my desire. While there I explored conceptual details of circular economy principles in companies and the scaling patterns of company waste.

items.name: Shifting Winds of Power: An Analysis on Denmark's Energy Island
items.description: As a journalist in the Michigan Journal International Affairs, I was fortunate to work alongside some great indivudals and produce a recent piece analyzing Denmark's decision to build the world's first energy-island and respective geopolitical impacts.

items.name: Multi-objective Optimization of Coal Retirements
items.description: Worked on a project creating and researching a multi-objective optimization of coal retirements in the Mid-Atlantic region to map future equitable pathways to take into account social and environmental costs as well as the financial costs of coal plants.

items.name: National Assessment of Wind and Solar Resources
items.description: Alongside fellow researchers, we conducted a comprehensive study analyzing the reliability impact of wind and solar resources on the US Western Interconnect power grid. Published work in leading Renewable Energy journal and fortunate to present work at multiple conferences!

items.name: Telemetry package
items.description: Member of the Microsoft Office division. Worked alongside software developers, attorneys, and product managers to develop a telemetry package for managing resource allocation, product details, and consumer privacy.
